name: A. A+B
statement:
You are given an expression of the form a{+}b, where a and b are
integers from 0 to 9. You have to evaluate it and print the result.
editorial:
There are multiple ways to solve this problem.Most interpreted languages
have some function that takes the string, evaluates it as code, and then
returns the result. One of the examples is the function in Python. If
the language you use supports something like that, you can read the
input as a string and use it as the argument of such a function.Suppose
you use a language where this is impossible. There are still many
approaches to this problem. The most straightforward one is to take the
first and the last characters of the input string, calculate their ASCII
codes, and then subtract the ASCII code of the character from them to
get these digits as integers, not as characters. Then you can just add
them up and print the result.
